data.title: Who We Are — Eubank Animal Clinic
data.text:
Meet Ashlee Andrews, DVM - Owner/Veterinarian

Dr. Ashlee Andrews was born and raised here in Albuquerque. She attended the University of New Mexico for her undergraduate studies and was a member of the Lobo track and cross-country teams. She attended veterinary school at Colorado State University and graduated in 2005. She enjoys soft tissue surgery and wound management. Her favorite part of being a veterinarian is supporting the human/animal bond between clients and their pets.

In her free time, she enjoys running and spending time with her six children.

Meet Rebecca Yarne, DVM - Veterinarian

Dr Rebecca Yarne grew up in Connecticut and received her undergraduate degree from Kenyon College. She later moved to New Mexico and fell in love with the beauty of the southwest. She received her Doctor of Veterinary Medicine from Colorado State University and completed a year long internship in equine medicine and surgery in Ocala, FL before returning to New Mexico. She initially worked as a mixed animal veterinarian but for the past 11 yrs. she focused on shelter medicine and surgery in a shelter with a low-income clinic. During this time, she developed her skills and special interests in orthopedic surgery, dentistry as well as general surgery. She joined Eubank Animal Clinic in November 2022 and is very excited to now be able to offer orthopedic services to the community.

Dr Yarne loves living in the East Mountains with her two daughters and husband. They enjoy riding their horses and spending time outdoors. They have five cats, two dogs, two goats, five horses, a donkey and many chickens. Her other passions are hiking (particularly Colorado 14ers), backpacking, camping and skiing.

Meet Jenny Garb, DVM - Veterinarian

In 2003, Dr. Garb graduated from the college of veterinary medicine at TAMU. She spent 14 years practicing emergency and critical care medicine in Houston and Albuquerque. During these years, she developed a passion for managing complicated acute illnesses, trauma and toxicities in both dogs and cats. In 2017 she joined the Eubank Animal Clinic and started the second half of her career as a general practitioner. Although emergency medicine still flows through her veins, she has developed a deep love for her current work and for the people she encounters daily. From her fantastic colleagues and support staff to her beloved clients and their cherished pets- she thrives on the connections that she has formed. She has broadened her professional interests to include chronic disease management, pain management, geriatric care and feline medicine.

When not at work she is a traveler, a lover of all things wild, a fan of her beloved daughter and a slave to her own pets.

Meet Mary England, DVM - Veterinarian

Dr. England is a New Mexican native who has been working in veterinary hospitals since she was 16 years old. She has always had a home filled with furry and feathered friends. After attending veterinary school at Iowa State University, she then returned home to New Mexico to continue her career. She has practiced both emergency and general medicine although she has special interests in surgery, ultrasound imaging, and fear free practice. She strives to provide families with education and support so their bond with their pets can continue to grow.

When not helping pets at work she enjoys spending time with her three children, husband, and many pets.

Meet Angela Harrell, DVM - Veterinarian

Dr Angela Harrell is an Albuquerque native who attended Eldorado High School and went on to earn her Bachelor of Science with a major in biology and minor in chemistry at the University of New Mexico in 2013. She worked in the veterinary field for 20 years as a receptionist, technician, manager and even a zookeeper at the ABQ Biopark Zoo before going on to vet school. Angela attended Ross University School of Veterinary Medicine, completed her clinical year at Colorado State University, and graduated with highest honors in 2020. Her special interests include exotic companion animals, wildlife and emergency and critical care medicine.

Dr Harrell enjoys spending time with her longtime partner Bill and their two daughters exploring and adventuring in the outdoors. They especially enjoy skiing and snowboarding, hiking, and hanging out near any body of water. They also stay quite busy at home taking care of a variety of pets including dogs, cats, chickens, reptiles, amphibians, and fish.

Dr Harrell is particularly interested in the human-animal bond and looks forward to providing the highest quality veterinary care for all her patients from dogs and cats to the smallest most non-traditional species.

Meet Brooke Rosen, DVM - Veterinarian

Dr. Rosen was born and raised in El Paso, Texas, and attended Brown University where she received a bachelor’s degree in Biology in 1996. After weathering the cold Northeast, she decided she needed to stay west of the Mississippi River, so she returned to Austin, Texas for several years. Dr. Rosen received her DVM degree from Texas A&M College of Veterinary Medicine in 2004 and after graduation, she moved to Albuquerque, where a job at Eubank Animal Clinic was waiting. "Spay and neuter" is Dr. Rosen's main passion--her home is always filled with anywhere from three to six rescue canine.

Meet Mary Berry, DVM - Veterinarian

Dr. Mary Berry was born and raised in Albuquerque and attended NMSU for her undergraduate degree. She then attended Colorado State University for her veterinary degree, graduating in 1984. Mary returned home and has been in small animal practice in the Albuquerque area since. She is a member of the NM Veterinary Medical Association and is a past-President. She has been at Eubank Animal Clinic for over 20 years!

Mary and her husband, Bruce, became involved as volunteers for NM Search and Rescue (SAR) in the late 80’s. Training search dogs has remained Mary’s primary interest away from work. She calls it her “volunteer profession”, and it has provided her many remarkable experiences, including disaster deployments to the Pentagon for 9/11 and Hurricane Katrina. Mostly though, Mary provides SAR expertise in New Mexico and the Southwest in wilderness settings. Her current search dog is “Indy”, a yellow Labrador Retriever.

Meet Dr. Kayleigh Glandon, DVM - Veterinarian

Dr. Kayleigh Glandon is a native New Mexican and grew up in Albuquerque. She attended UNM for her undergraduate studies, where she studied Biology and Psychology, and graduated in 2016. At UNM she was part of the spirit program where she was a COED cheerleader. Dr. Glandon graduated in 2023 from Colorado State University with her Doctorate of Veterinary Medicine, and has recently moved back to New Mexico to practice veterinary medicine.

Dr. Glandon enjoys spending time with her friends and family. She enjoys skiing in the wintertime and water sports in the summertime. She stays busy with her fiancé fixing up their new home.

Dr. Glandon is interested in furthering her knowledge of exotic animals and is looking forward to starting her new career in Albuquerque.
